string: ACT I
PROLOGUE
PROLOGUE
speaker: PROLOGUE

string: Two households, both alike in dignity,
speaker: PROLOGUE

string: In fair Verona, where we lay our scene,
speaker: PROLOGUE

string: From ancient grudge break to new mutiny,
speaker: PROLOGUE

string: Where civil blood makes civil hands unclean.
speaker: PROLOGUE

string: From forth the fatal loins of these two foes
speaker: PROLOGUE

string: A pair of star-cross'd lovers take their life;
speaker: PROLOGUE

string: Whose misadventured piteous overthrows
speaker: PROLOGUE

string: Do with their death bury their parents' strife.
speaker: PROLOGUE

string: The fearful passage of their death-mark'd love,
speaker: PROLOGUE

string: And the continuance of their parents' rage,
speaker: PROLOGUE

string: Which, but their children's end, nought could remove,
speaker: PROLOGUE

string: Is now the two hours' traffic of our stage;
speaker: PROLOGUE

string: The which if you with patient ears attend,
speaker: PROLOGUE

string: What here shall miss, our toil shall strive to mend.
speaker: PROLOGUE
